packagegui.title: Proxy server: Authentication

field.description: Select an authentication method. This will allow users to be authenticated by local or external services.
Enter here the IP or hostname of the server that will perform the authentication.
Enter here the port to use to connect to the authentication server. Leave this field blank to use the authentication method's default port.
This string will be displayed at the top of the authentication request window.
field.default_value: Please enter your credentials to access the proxy

field.description: The number of authenticator processes to spawn. If many authentications are expected within a short timeframe, increase this number accordingly.

This specifies for how long (in seconds) the proxy server assumes an externally validated username and password combination is valid (Time To Live). When the TTL expires, the user will be prompted for credentials again.Default value is 5.
If this option is enabled, even users tagged as unrestricted through access control are required to authenticate to use the proxy.
Enter each subnet or IP address on a new line (in CIDR format, e.g.: 10.5.0.0/16, 192.168.1.50/32) that should not be asked for authentication to access the proxy.
Enter here the user DN to use to connect to the LDAP server.
Enter here the password to use to connect to the LDAP server.
For LDAP authentication, enter here the base domain in the LDAP server.
Comma-separated list of secondary servers to be used for NT domain authentication.
The RADIUS secret for RADIUS authentication.
